arts.ttl: Joshua Kimmich highlights importance of consistency after Bayern Munich's 4-0 win at Heidenheim
arts.sum: After the 4-0 routing of Heidenheim, Kimmich, who scored Bayern’s fourth goal of the match, stressed the importance of the Rekordmeister needing to exhibit a level of consistency, which they have not necessarily done for parts of this season across all fronts. Bayern Munich shook off their Champions League exit disappointment at the hands of Inter with an emphatic 4-0 Bundesliga win over Heidenheim at the Voith-Arena.

arts.ttl: Vincent Kompany lauds Bayern Munich’s emphatic 4-0 win against Heidenheim
arts.sum: “But if you watch Heidenheim’s last few games, especially the one against Leverkusen here - it wasn’t easy for the opponent,” he said, referring to Bayer Leverkusen’s gritty 1-0 win on Matchday 28. The Bavarians played away at Heidenheim and won 4-0, courtesy of a high-octane performance in the first half.

arts.ttl: Konraid Laimer praises Bayern Munich’s positive reaction after devastating Champions League loss to Inter Milan
arts.sum: Konrad Laimer, touched on his sides reaction against Heidenheim following Wednesday evening’s disappointing result. “We wanted to show a reaction today.

arts.ttl: Bayern Munich’s Max Eberl has contentious exchange with reporter before win over Heidenheim
arts.sum: Max Eberl asked before the game whether the squad needs an overhaul after the CL exit: Prior to Bayern Munich ’s 4-0 victory over Heidenheim in the Bundesliga, board member for sport Max Eberl engaged in a back-and-forth interview with Sky Sport that saw the executive have a contentious exchange with the reporter (via @iMiaSanMia ):

arts.ttl: Juventus monitor Bayern Munich center-back Kim-Min Jae and two youngsters as potential defensive reinforcements in summer market
arts.sum: As the Bianconeri lack structure and are seemingly quite brittle defensively this season, Juventus look to rectify this grave issue by bolstering the back-line in the summer market. Milanese journal…

arts.ttl: Goal in Heidenheim sees Harry Kane surpass Erling Haaland for another Bundesliga goalscoring record
arts.sum: Harry Kane’s opener in Bayern Munich’s 4-0 away win over Heidenheim helped propel the Bavarians towards a straightforward win in the title race, whilst simultaneously seeing the Englishman best Erling Haaland's previous goalscoring record. The Bavarians' talisman scored the opener in their 4-0 humbling of Heidenheim on Matchday 30 with a finish that would see England's record goalscorer and captain take his tally for the season up to 24, whilst becoming the fastest player ever to reach 60 Bundesliga goals, having done so in the exact same number of games.

arts.ttl: Joshua Kimmich believes Bayern Munich’s 4-0 win against Heidenheim was important
arts.sum: “Maybe it looks easy from the outside, but it was an important and good win,” he declared. Reacting to the win, the skipper declared that the win was important.

arts.ttl: Four Observations from Bayern Munich’s emphatic 4-0 win against FC Heidenheim
arts.sum: It is not every game that Bayern will hold such an uncompromising lead over their opponent, and it is opportunities like these that need to be taken and made advantage of to give Bayern’s youth their much-deserved chance. As an extension of the discussion concerning the high quality of the goals scored tonight, it displayed what Bayern needs in the final third.

arts.ttl: Bavarian Podcast Works — Postgame Show: Heidenheim 0-4 Bayern Munich (Bundesliga)
arts.sum: A look at the starting XI and our thoughts on the rotation. Heidenheim was overwhelmed form the beginning and Bayern Munich seized its opportunity.

arts.ttl: Vincent Kompany: "It was a complete performance by the boys”
arts.sum: Vincent Kompany doesn’t want to play down the challenge of playing against Heidenheim.
